title: What Keen is the HARDEST!!!
content:
I could have sworn that this was posted... but i can't find it. Maybe it was a different one.

Keep in mind you are voting for the hardest on "Hard" difficulty setting.

title: Hmm.
content:
You'll have to be more specific when you say "Hard," I think.

To me, given the ability to save mid-level, Keens 4, 5, and 6 are extremely "easy" relative to Keens 1, 2, and 3. Any part of a level that seems challenging can be essentially save-stated and attempted time and time again until passed, without the aggravation of doing the entire level over upon failure.

At the same time, the enemies in Keens 4, 5, and 6 aren't nearly as threatening or quick-moving as the enemies in the first trilogy. The most dangerous enemy I can think of in each episode (4's Skypest, 5's Shelley, and 6's Bip) are only threatening because they catch you off guard by attacking by surprise--there is no way any enemy in 4, 5, or 6 can be threatening all by themselves in the middle of a hallway. Compare that to Keen1's Vorticons, Keen2's Elites, and Keen3's Vortininjas... Those things can tear through a level, jumping over obstacles, shooting, moving faster than you, etc. They pose much more threat than a Poison Slug, Sparky, or Bloog can.

Also, you didn't specify how much of the game we're talking about. I might feel that The Bloogdome has a part in it on Hard mode that isn't fair and should be edited to be easier--but that's just one part of what I feel is the easiest episode of Keen. Compare that to the entirety of Keen3, and it looks like a snoozefest.

To me, the hardest Keen to complete, start to finish, without cheats, is Keen3. The levels are so brutal, unbalanced, and apparently untested, it's a relief to discover we only have to pass a level or two to see the ending. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]

title: Re: Hmm.
content:
I beg to differ. Keen 3 is has the hardest altogether levels (due to the lack of saving ingame. If you coudln't do that in 4-6, some levels would be really irritating) but I don't think the mangling machine is really too bad. All you need is to get your timing down, and have enough bullets.
I think the hardest levels in Keen3 are the three castle levels that are grouped together. I honestly don't think I ever even bothered to beat those levels.
Actually I found Keen2 the most irritatingly hard. I hated the Washington DC one.
I don't know about Keen 4-6's AI not being as hard though. THere are a ton of foes in those (4 especially) that you can't even beat, and the keen4 enemies that you can beat you can only beat in certain situations (pests, the wormmouth things that jump out at you, the rock/mushrooms that jump at you)
I think the eagle and fireball guy to be two of the hardest foes if you're in a corner (the fire level in keen4 on hard is very difficult).

title: Re: Hmm.
content:
I have played 4-5 more than 1-3, but I thought 1-3 were DEFINATELY more difficult than 4-5. I don't really play 6 much so I can't judge that one well.___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

title: haha
content:
Na'ah, man, you can sum it up in three syllables:

VOR-TI-CONS.

Seriously--what Keen4-6 enemy has half the AI that a Vorticon does?

Licks move straight for Keen at all times--if they can't reach him, they hop against a wall. Poison Slugs turn towards Keen after they deposit their slime, which is at a random interval. Arachnuts aim for Keen; Bluebirds aim for Keen; Mimrocks aim for Keen...
Sparky charges like a Garg; Robo Red is an obstacle, not an enemy; Shelley dive-bombs you if you don't pay attention; Volte-faces follow paths...
Bloogs can't jump; Giks can't jump; Flects can't jump. Bobbas and Babobbas don't react to Keen's presence. Orbatrixes and Blorbs are too enigmatic.

I mean... I GUESS you could make an argument that the Shikadi DOGS (Shockshunds) are like Vorticon Elites... but the Shikadi themselves are a joke. There's no enemy Keen has encountered who is as intelligent (gameplay-wise) as the first troublemakers he stumbled into on Mars.

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]

title: Re: haha
content:
Keen2 as a whole is pretty hard, I think (especially Weaponry B and the final level), but Keen3 has Cape Canavorta and the fort levels, which are harder than all the levels of Keen1 put together, so I'm going to go with Keen3. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img]

Note: I'm not including the Caves of Oblivion in Keen3's hard levels simply because you can't beat it by going the "normal" way, so you have to use the super-easy secret way."A man is the less likely to become great the more he is dominated by reason: few can achieve greatness - and none in art - if they are not dominated by illusion."
--Mr. Doctor

I think that in-level save feature of Keen 4-6 and (unfortunately) Duke Nukem 3D is the worst the developers could have included. It's for cfheaters.

Bio Menace's save feature is good.
Keen 1-3's too.

Jazz Jackrabbit's sucks because it not only resets your weapon ammo, but also your score (duh).

title: Re: haha
content:
No way, I dislike games that are unforgiving with their savegames. I get frustrated if I have to keep repeating a large part of the level just to get killed off at the same point over and over again. (Maybe it's just because I'm not very good, but hey.)

It's not so bad if you have health so that you can take a few hits before you die, but I find the "one hit and you're back to the start" style in Keen 1-3 very annoying.
